concise_definition: adj. 被动的, 消极的, 顺从的

definitions.explanation_en: Not active or responsive; accepting or enduring what happens without resistance or attempt to change it.
definitions.explanation_cn: 不主动或不反应的；接受或忍受发生的事情，而不试图抵抗或改变。
definitions.example_en: She took a passive role in the discussion, letting others make all the decisions.
definitions.example_cn: 她在讨论中采取了被动的态度，让别人做出所有决定。

definitions.explanation_en: In grammar, referring to a verb form in which the subject receives the action rather than performing it (e.g., 'The ball was thrown by John').
definitions.explanation_cn: 在语法中，指主语承受动作而非执行动作的动词形式（例如：'The ball was thrown by John'）。
definitions.example_en: The passive voice is often used in scientific writing to emphasize the action rather than the actor.
definitions.example_cn: 被动语态常用于科学写作中，以强调动作而非执行者。

definitions.explanation_en: Lacking energy, enthusiasm, or initiative; showing little interest or involvement.
definitions.explanation_cn: 缺乏活力、热情或主动性；表现出很少的兴趣或参与。
definitions.example_en: His passive attitude toward his health led to serious complications.
definitions.example_cn: 他对健康的消极态度导致了严重的并发症。

comparison.analysis: “Inactive” (不活跃的) 强调缺乏行动或运动，通常用于描述身体状态或系统未运作的情况，如机器停机或人久坐不动。而 “passive” 更侧重于心理或态度上的不抵抗、不干预，即使有行动能力也不采取行动。
“Submissive” (顺从的) 指主动屈从于权威或他人意志，常带有权力关系的意味，如下属服从上司。而 “passive” 不一定包含屈服的意图，可能只是漠然或不愿参与，不一定承认对方的权威。
“Receptive” (乐于接受的) 指对新想法、信息或影响持开放态度，通常带有积极含义。而 “passive” 常含贬义，暗示缺乏回应或主动性，即使接受外界影响，也并非出于意愿或参与。
